comments.body: This is not really introduced here, but it's really bad that we're generating shell scripts... Can't we just generate a list of variables and have a shell script that reads that instead? (Not sure at who this question is asked... Another time I may have another look at this myself.)
I can look at removing the generation of a shell script in a different PR.  Want this PR to just stop producing extra junk in unit files.
I don't really think stderr of iptables-save is meant to go to /etc/sysconfig/iptables... I believe it will only produce valid iptables syntax in stdout.
